Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit where it pleases - "waiting my turn" -, while the Dutch continue with their conviction that "anyone who wants to definitely should". This underlying cacoshism attracts comparisons with Asians.
I don't think that's without comparison either, yet these observations are very interesting.
